data.title: [Lua] support for addCustomEventListener()
data.body:
Currently there is no way to get called when end of frame.

In C++ addCustomEventListener to listen Director::EVENT_AFTER_DRAW would do.

but that is not available in Lua currently.

milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.title: Assetsmanager bug fix
data.body: Assetsmanager bug fix，avoid assetsmanager release the downloader crash

data.title: NavMesh::update crash if Scene does not have Layer

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
Since cocos2d-x 3.7, if a `Scene` is created without a `Layer` as a child, the application will immediately crash with EXC_BAD_ACCESS in `NavMesh::update()`. The call stack is as follows:

```
Director::drawScene()
    Scene::stepPhysicsAndNavigation()
        NavMesh::update()
```

If `CC_USE_NAVMESH` is set to `0` then another crash will occur in `Physics3DWorld::stepSimulate()`.

data.title: Fix the physics timestamp with smooth interpolation
data.body:
Hi,
In order to avoid stuttering and other graphical artifacts, I have to set the autoUpdate(false) and manually fix the timestep for physics.

After using a fixed timestep for physics, I have to manually interpolate all graphical nodes which depend on  physic bodies.

See this:
http://gafferongames.com/game-physics/fix-your-timestep/

Ideally this should be performed by the engine out of the box: I think it is a must to have a fixed timestep for physics2d engine

data.title: Re-implement Android Editbox.
data.body:
Now the EditBox behavior on Android platform is the same as iOS, maybe even better than iOS.
It supports Multiline input.  
More tests are needed to be done before the PR could be merged.

data.title: Editbox setInputFlag as "password", enter key can't complete input.
data.body:
`Engine version: Cocos 2d-x v3.7`
`Test environment:  XiaoMi2 / Samsung GT-I8552`

Editbox setInputFlag as "password", click the "enter" on the soft keyboard, the input have not completed, but the "enter" as a character.

data.title: EditBox cursor location not update on iphone 5
data.body:
`Engine version: Cocos 2d-x v3.7`
`Test environment:  iphone5`

When character is beyond its effective area, 
the cursor will not update location to the back, 
need to press the backspace key will be updated.

data.title: Fixed #9507 : logic error in isMaxLengthEnabled handling in UITextFie…
TypeError: ccui.CheckBox.getSelectedState = UICheckBoxDeprecated.setSelectedState
data.body:
cocos/ui/DeprecatedUIFunc.lua:121:
--- source ---
function UICheckBoxDeprecated.getSelectedState(self)
   deprecatedTip("ccui.CheckBox:getSelectedState", "ccui.CheckBox:getSelected")
   return self:getSelected()
end
ccui.CheckBox.getSelectedState = UICheckBoxDeprecated.setSelectedState
--- end ---

Maybe that is derived from here: cocos/ui/UICheckBox.h:191:
--- source --- 
/**
     \* Change Checkbox state to selected.
     *
     \* @deprecated use `isSelected()` instead
     \* @param selected   True means the Checkbox will be selected, false means unselected.
     */
    CC_DEPRECATED_ATTRIBUTE void setSelectedState(bool selected){this->setSelected(selected);}

```
/**
 * Query whether the CheckBox is selected or not.
 *
 * @deprecated use `setSelected(bool)` instead.
 * @return selected    true that checkbox is selected, false otherwise.
 */
CC_DEPRECATED_ATTRIBUTE bool getSelectedState()const{return this->isSelected();}
```

--- end ---
